intro: Stenandrium heterotrichum, commonly known as the variable stenandrium, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of South America. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae, which includes many species of shrubs and herbs. The plant is characterized by its opposite, elliptic leaves and small, clustered flowers with four petals. Its fruit is a capsule that splits open to release seeds. It is often found in moist, shaded environments within forest understories.
